Medford.The Village at Medford Center:
The Village at Medford Center, formerly known as The Medford Center, is a regional shopping center in east Medford, Oregon, United States. Anchored by Sears, the 420,000-square-foot (39,000 m2) mall is the oldest and one of the largest in Jackson County, alongside Rogue Valley Mall.


== History ==
Before the complex was constructed, the land was used for agricultural and for the grazing of livestock, with The Village at Medford Center opening as The Medford Center in 1959, as one of the first shopping centers in Medford located adjacent to Interstate 5.
